availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John E. McIntire (Washington County, Kentucky, farmer and judge)

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, farmer and judge. Kentucky native. Married to Permelia A. Johnson McIntire. Married to Anna M. Johnson McIntire. Married to Sarah A. Edelen McIntire. Father of Ellen McIntire, Kate M. McIntire, Louisa McIntire, James McIntire, Anna McIntire, and Mary McIntire. Farmer in Washington County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1860. Judge of the Washington County Court in 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Washington County, District 2, p. 2; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Washington County, District 2, p. 1; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Washington County, Springfield, p. 31-2; Find A Grave, "Judge John E 'Jack' McIntire (1812-1887)," Memorial #105270911, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=105270911&ref=acom (accessed May 5, 2017).
